A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I liked it a lot more on a second viewing\, and even though I saw the original in '77\, I'm not certain I'm the target market for the latest instalment.  Like a lot of people\, I had issues with the flying Leia\, overuse of porgs\, racing-goats and crystal foxes\, a messy scene as a whole on the casino planet\, Finn being used as a plot device whenever anything New Order is required\, and the dumbing down of Hux for comedic effect to name a few.  I actually had no issues with Luke's characterization\, but the scene with the Praetorian guard left me flat\, as it relied too much on Snoke's guard being flashy and wielding \"cool-ninja-weapons\"\, and less on core choreography of what could have been an amazing sabre battle. Personally it falls below the original trilogy\, but above the prequels for me.
